plot.tk.dictTK package¶

Submodules¶

plot.tk.dictTK.convert_to_internal module¶

Convert a user configuration dictionary to an internal parameter dictionary.

plot.tk.dictTK.convert_to_internal.convert_to_internal(user_dict)[source]¶

Convert to “plot” internal dictionary.

use the internal key defined by user_dict[“__”] as the new key.

Parameters:user_dict (dict) – user configuration dictionary
Returns:A new dictionary with new keys.

plot.tk.dictTK.default module¶

Replace all the “v” field of the input dictionary with the default value (i.e. the first entry of the list).

Example: {“k”: {“v”: [1,2,3]}} will be changed to {“k”: {“v”: 1}}

plot.tk.dictTK.default.default(d)[source]¶

Return a new dictionary with default values

Assuming the dictionary has “v” field value [v1, v2, ...], the returned dictionary will have value “v”: v1

Parameters:d (dict) – input dictionary with structure like {“k”: {“v”: [1,2,3]}}
Returns:a new dictionary with default values.

plot.tk.dictTK.merge module¶

Merge two dictionaries into one.

plot.tk.dictTK.merge.merge(dict1, dict2)[source]¶

Recrusively merge two dictionaries.

The two input dictionaries can have arbitrary depths. If there is a conflict, values from dict1 will override dict2.

Parameters:
  • dict1 (dict) – input dictionary 1
  • dict2 (dict) – input dictionary 2
Returns:

A new dictionary that combines both inputs.

plot.tk.dictTK.update module¶

Update the second dictionary with the contents of the first dictionary.

plot.tk.dictTK.update.update(src_dict, target_dict)[source]¶

Recursively update.

Update the target_dict using content from the src_dict. Items from src_dict which are not in target_dict will be discarded. A easy way to remember the priority is “1st argument has #1 priority”.

Parameters:
  • src_dict (dict) – new information source
  • target_dict (dict) – target dictionary to be updated
Returns:

a new dictionary with updated entries.

plot.tk.dictTK.wrap_value module¶

Wrap the value of a nested dictionary with a new field {“v”: value}

plot.tk.dictTK.wrap_value.wrap_value(d)[source]¶

Wrap the value field

Add a new field “v”, which contains the actual value under the key.

Parameters:d (dict) – input dictionary
Returns:a new dictionary with values wrapped inside “v” fields
